security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown text with typography design guidelines. No executable code, network requests, file system access, or cryptographic operations exist. All 38 static findings are false positives triggered by JSON field names and benign text patterns. The scanner incorrectly interprets words like DES (within design), hash, source, and font names as security threats. The skill-report.json explicitly states No executable code, network requests, or file system access detected.

content.value_statement: Generic fonts make designs look amateur. This skill provides expert typography guidelines to create visually striking and professional text layouts using curated font recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Recommends high-quality font choices for different contexts
Provides font pairing principles with contrast guidelines
Suggests specific font families for code, editorial, and technical content
Advises on font weight and size ratios for visual impact
Recommends loading fonts from Google Fonts
limitations: Only provides text-based recommendations, no visual examples
Limited to Google Fonts library suggestions
Focuses on web fonts, not print typography

use_cases.title: Improve readability

prompt_templates.title: Basic font selection
prompt_templates.scenario: Choosing fonts for a new website
prompt_templates.prompt: I need typography recommendations for a modern tech blog. What fonts should I use for headings and body text?

prompt_templates.title: Code font pairing
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm creating documentation for a programming library. What font combinations work well for code snippets and explanatory text?

prompt_templates.title: Editorial design
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create an editorial-style web layout with high visual impact. What font pairings create strong contrast?

prompt_templates.title: Advanced hierarchy
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a complete typographic system for a design system with headings, body text, captions, and code. Include weight and size recommendations.

output_examples.input: What fonts should I use for a technical documentation site?
output: For technical documentation, use IBM Plex Mono for code snippets and IBM Plex Sans for body text
IBM Plex family provides excellent readability and technical aesthetic
Pair with Space Grotesk for headings to add visual interest
Use weight 400 for body text and 600-700 for headings
Maintain 3:1 size ratio between headings and body text

output_examples.input: Help me choose fonts for my design portfolio
output: Use Bricolage Grotesque for headlines to show distinctive character
Pair with a clean serif like Crimson Pro for body text
This creates high contrast between display and reading typography
Load both from Google Fonts for reliable web delivery

best_practices: Load fonts from Google Fonts for reliable web delivery
Use extreme weight contrasts (100/200 vs 800/900) for visual impact
Limit your design to one distinctive font family to maintain cohesion
Test font combinations at different screen sizes before finalizing
anti_patterns: Avoid overused fonts like Inter, Roboto, Open Sans, and Lato
Do not use small weight differences (400 vs 600) - go for extremes
Never rely on system default fonts for professional designs

faq.question: Which platforms support this typography skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code on any platform

faq.question: Can I get visual previews of font combinations?
faq.answer: This skill provides text recommendations only. Use Google Fonts to preview combinations visually

faq.question: Does it support languages other than English?
faq.answer: Font recommendations work for any language supported by the chosen typefaces

faq.question: Is my design data kept private?
faq.answer: Yes, this is a prompt-based skill with no data collection or external connections

faq.question: What if Google Fonts is blocked in my region?
faq.answer: The principles apply to any font service. Substitute with similar fonts from available sources

faq.question: How is this different from generic font advice?
faq.answer: Provides specific, curated font families and contrast ratios based on professional design principles
